B1: Describe a challenge you faced and how you dealt with it.
What are the advantages and disadvantages of working from home?
Explain how you organize your time when you are busy.
Describe a tradition in your country and its meaning.
Talk about a book that changed your thinking.
What makes a good teacher or mentor? Give examples.
Describe an important decision you made and why.
How do you stay motivated when learning something difficult?
Explain a skill you have and how you learned it.
What are some problems in big cities and possible solutions?
Describe a healthy lifestyle and how to achieve it.
What is a good way to save money? Share tips.
Explain how social media affects communication today.
Describe a memorable trip and what you learned.
What are the pros and cons of public transport?
How do you deal with stress? Give examples.
What makes a great friend? Explain.
Describe your ideal job and why it suits you.
What environmental issue worries you most and why?
Explain a time you had to work in a team.
B1+: Describe a goal you set recently and the steps you are taking.
What qualities make an effective leader? Give real examples.
Explain a change you made in your life and its impact.
Compare traditional learning with online learning.
Describe a community problem and suggest realistic solutions.
What role should art play in education? Explain.
Explain how you would welcome a new colleague to a team.
Describe a technology that helps you be more productive.
Discuss why people procrastinate and how to overcome it.
What advice would you give to someone moving to your city?
Explain a habit you built successfully and how you kept it.
Discuss the benefits and risks of sharing personal data online.
Describe a difficult conversation you handled and the outcome.
Explain how you prepare for an important presentation.
Discuss why people travel and what they gain from it.
Describe a company you admire and why.
Explain a time you changed your opinion after new evidence.
Discuss how sports can teach life skills.
Describe a simple project you would like to start and your plan.
Explain how culture influences the way people communicate.
B2: Argue for or against a four-day workweek and justify your view.
Explain how governments and individuals can reduce food waste.
Discuss the impact of smartphones on attention and learning.
Describe an ethical dilemma at work and how it should be resolved.
Explain how to design a fair performance review for a team.
Compare living in a capital city with living in a small town.
Discuss how climate change may affect your region over the next 20 years.
Explain the skills people need to adapt to automation.
Debate the pros and cons of remote education for teenagers.
Describe how you would manage a project with a tight deadline.
Explain how to evaluate the credibility of online information.
Discuss whether tourism is helpful or harmful to local culture.
Explain the importance of sleep and how to improve it.
Describe how you would reduce plastic use in a company.
Argue whether creativity can be taught and how.
Discuss the advantages and limits of AI assistants.
Explain how volunteering can benefit both individuals and society.
Describe strategies for resolving conflicts in a team.
Debate the value of university education compared to vocational paths.
Explain why lifelong learning is essential in modern careers.
B2+: Evaluate different ways to measure productivity in knowledge work.
Explain how to build a persuasive argument using evidence and logic.
Discuss how international travel changes people’s perspectives.
Analyze the main causes of burnout and propose systemic fixes.
Explain how to balance privacy and security in digital services.
Compare two leadership styles and when each is effective.
Discuss strategies to make cities more sustainable and livable.
Explain how to design an inclusive hiring process.
Analyze why misinformation spreads and how to counter it.
Evaluate the effect of influencer culture on consumer behavior.
Explain how to give constructive feedback that people accept.
Discuss the ethics of targeted advertising online.
Explain how organizations can foster innovation without chaos.
Analyze the trade-offs of gig-economy work.
Explain how schools could better prepare students for real life.
Discuss how language shapes thought, with examples.
Explain a major mistake you learned from and general lessons for others.
Analyze the role of failure in creative work.
Explain how to negotiate win-win outcomes in difficult situations.
Discuss how remote teams can build trust across time zones.
C1: Critically evaluate a policy your city has introduced in the last five years.
Explain how organizations should govern AI tools to manage risk and opportunity.
Analyze the relationship between economic growth and environmental limits.
Discuss how to design incentives that encourage ethical behavior at scale.
Evaluate the strengths and weaknesses of your country’s education system.
Explain how cognitive biases influence everyday decisions and how to mitigate them.
Argue for a reform you believe would improve public health and justify it.
Analyze how media framing affects public opinion on complex issues.
Explain how to create a culture of continuous learning in a company.
Evaluate different models of remote/hybrid work and their long-term effects.
Analyze the role of regulation in fast-moving tech industries.
Explain how to balance shareholder value with stakeholder interests.
Critique a popular idea in your field and propose a better alternative.
Analyze how migration influences innovation and social cohesion.
Explain how to design fair algorithms and measure their impact.
Discuss the ethics of using personal data for research.
Evaluate the effectiveness of international organizations in solving global problems.
Explain how storytelling can drive organizational change.
Analyze how trust is built and lost in institutions.
Propose a strategic plan for a nonprofit to scale its impact.
C2: Formulate and defend a nuanced position on universal basic income, considering trade-offs and evidence.
Critically assess the claim that technological progress inevitably increases inequality.
Develop a policy framework for governing frontier AI systems while preserving innovation.
Compare competing theories of consciousness and evaluate their explanatory power.
Construct a rigorous argument for or against strict carbon pricing as the core climate policy.
Analyze the long-term cultural effects of ubiquitous surveillance and data collection.
Evaluate whether international law can keep pace with autonomous weapons.
Assess the philosophical and practical limits of free speech in digital platforms.
Derive principles for allocating scarce medical resources during crises and defend them.
Critique GDP as a measure of progress and propose a superior alternative.
Defend or reject the precautionary principle in emerging technologies with case studies.
Synthesize insights from behavioral economics to redesign a national savings policy.
Evaluate the claim that multilingualism enhances cognitive flexibility, citing research.
Propose a governance model for global climate migration that is politically feasible.
Assess the ethics of human enhancement technologies beyond therapy.
Debate whether democracies can solve long-term problems better than autocracies.
Propose a framework to audit algorithmic systems for fairness across cultures.
Critically appraise the idea of degrowth in high-income countries.
Defend a position on data ownership in the age of generative AI.
Construct a strategic plan for international cooperation on pandemic prevention.
